revised_title: Electric Field Disintegration of Water Drops: A Reassessment of Zeleny's Theory
tldr: This study investigates the disintegration of water drops in an electric field and challenges Zeleny's theory. The author shows that a water drop becomes unstable when its length is 19 times its equatorial diameter and calculates the critical electric field, which agrees with laboratory experiments. The research provides insights into the mechanics of water drop disintegration and its role in thunderstorm formation.
